comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content: I read the date on the sticker as 4/7/17  (April 7, 1917)

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: @technogeo --- that was the day after the U. S. declared war on Germany, and entered World War I (April 6, 1917). So the sticker must have been placed deliberately to cover the earlier scratched-on date, and allow reuse of the 1913 photo to publicize war preparedness.

comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content: Recycled photos as propaganda! Nicely done, Wystan!

comment.author: 27646985@N00
comment._content: You are right. That sailor is getting yelled at for his kit being out of place.
